info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 12 at 8:22AM CDT until June 12 at 3:34PM CDT by NWS Austin/San Antonio TX
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Austin/San Antonio TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas...
Comal River At New Braunfels affecting Gonzales, Comal and Guadalupe Counties.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Comal River at New Braunfels.
* WHEN...From this morning to late this afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding extends into low areas near the tube chute at Prince Solms Park above San Antonio Street and low areas of the flood plain.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 11.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 9.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:45 AM CDT Thursday was 11.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 11.9 feet late this morning. It will then fall below flood stage late this morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.9 feet on 05/15/1994. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 345 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO LATE THIS AFTERNOON

area.areaDesc: Comal, TX; Gonzales, TX; Guadalupe, TX
